result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Joseph L Vitlas was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 67 days sentence credit.
AMENDED 12-11-2015:  Defendant IS ELIGIBLE for Substance Abuse Program (Earned Release Program) after serving 1 year.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to fine.  Balance to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Victim Impact Panel has been completed.

Blood draw fee and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.  Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Muskego Police Department.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

superTimeConds.notes: 50 hours per year for 3 years of Extended Supervision.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph L Vitlas in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

5 YEARS 6 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 67 days)
  -  2 YEARS 6 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT to begin forthwith;
  -  3 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Victim Impact Panel has been completed. 
*Community Service: Perform 150 hours total (50 hours per year for 3 years of extended supervision)

FINE $3,039.00 (apply $2,970.00 cash bail and balance to be paid as a condition of extended supervision); REFUND: $330.00 TO POSTER JEFFREY VITLAS.

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

BLOOD DRAW FEE: $35.00 pad through Waukesha County Circuit Couirt to be fowarded to the City of Muskego Police Department.

DL REVOCATION:  36 MONTHS.
IGNITION INTERLOCK:  36 MONTHS.

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant Joseph L Vitlas in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed by operation of law. Defense requests a Pre-sentence Investigation. Court grants request. Presentence to be compiled and filed within 45 days. Court will set a sentencing date in 60 days. Defendant remanded to the custody of the Sheriff. Court orders bail revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Plea/sentencing hearing on September 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
DEFENDANT PREVIOUSLY POSTED $2000.00, NEEDS TO POST AN ADDITIONAL $1300.00 with the same conditions.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Defendant Joseph L Vitlas in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. WCS letter addressed.  Defense requests another date in 60 days. State requests that bail be revoked and forfeited and Court set additional cash bail. Court increases cash bail to $3300.00. Defendant previously posted $2000.00 and needs to post an additional $1300.00 for a total of $3300.00. Court will not revoked the prior bail. Amended Information filed. Reading waived.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
